questions.description: citizen who plans to adopt or has adopted a child from a country that is party to the Hague Adoption Convention
questions.tool_tip: Part1.  Basis of Filing.   See USCIS Form G-1055, Fee Schedule, available at www.uscis.gov/g-1055, for information on filing fees.  Check if You are a U.S. citizen who plans to adopt or has adopted a child from a country that is party to the Hague Adoption Convention.

questions.description: Been arrested, cited, charged, indicted, convicted, fined, or imprisoned for breaking or violating any law or ordinance, excluding traffic violations, but including driving or operating a vehicle while intoxicated or while impaired by or under the influence of alcohol or other intoxicant? Check this box for No
questions.tool_tip: Part 2. Information About You. 10.  Have you ever, whether in or outside the United States: A.  Been arrested, cited, charged, indicted, convicted, fined, or imprisoned for breaking or violating any law or ordinance, excluding traffic violations, but including driving or operating a vehicle while intoxicated or while impaired by or under the influence of alcohol or other intoxicant? Check this box for No.

questions.description: Been arrested, cited, charged, indicted, convicted, fined, or imprisoned for breaking or violating any law or ordinance, excluding traffic violations, but including driving or operating a vehicle while intoxicated or while impaired by or under the influence of alcohol or other intoxicant? Check this box for Yes
questions.tool_tip: Part 2. Information About You. Each of the following questions must be answered.  See "Duty of Disclosure" on Page 7 of the instructions to Form I-800A concerning your ongoing duty to disclose information in answer to these questions.  If the answer is "Yes" to any of the questions, provide a certified copy of the documentation showing the final disposition of each incident which resulted in arrest, indictment, conviction, and/or any other judicial or administrative action and a written statement giving details, including any mitigating circumstances, about each arrest, signed under penalty of perjury under U.S. law.  The written statement must show the date of each incident; place incident occurred (city/town, State/province, country); name of police department or other law enforcement administration or other entity involved; date of incarceration and name of facility, if applicable.  Provide a description of any type of counseling, rehabilitation, or other information that you would like considered in light of this history on a separate sheet of paper.10.  Have you ever, whether in or outside the United States: A.  Been arrested, cited, charged, indicted, convicted, fined, or imprisoned for breaking or violating any law or ordinance, excluding traffic violations, but including driving or operating a vehicle while intoxicated or while impaired by or under the influence of alcohol or other intoxicant? Check this box for Yes.

questions.description: Been the beneficiary of a pardon, amnesty, rehabilitation decree, other act of clemency, or similar action? Check this box for Yes

questions.tool_tip: Part 4. General Information. 3.   Provide a written description of the preadoption requirements, if any, of the State of the child's proposed residence when it is known that the child will be adopted in the United States, including a citation to the relevant State statutes and regulations.  Describe the steps that have already been taken or that are planned to comply with these requirements.  Any preadoption requirements which cannot be met at the time Form I-800A is filed because of the operation of State law must be noted and explained.NOTE:  If you need more space to complete, use a separate sheet of paper.  Write your name and USCIS Account Number, if known, at the top of each sheet of paper and indicate the part and number of the item to which the answer refers.

questions.description: Print this form and sign in Ink
questions.tool_tip: Part 5.  Certification and Signature of You, the Prospective Adoptive Parent(s) (Read the information on penalties in the instructions before completing this section.). Your Certificaiton. I certify, under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States, that: 1.  Each answer I have given to each question on Form I-800A and attached supplement(s) is true and correct to the best of my knowledge, information, and belief; and 2.  I understand the ongoing duty to disclose information concerning my suitability as an adoptive parent, as described on Page 7 of the instructions to Form I-800A, and I agree to notify the home study preparer and USCIS of any new information that I am required to disclose. Enter Your Signature. Print this form and sign in Ink.
